description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the winlogon elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-30067), the following updates have been released:

1. Determine your Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit).
2. Download the appropriate KB article update from the official Microsoft Update Catalog corresponding to your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (32-bit): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
3. Install the update and restart your system to apply the changes.

**Details**:
- This update addresses an integer overflow or wraparound issue that could lead to elevation of privilege in winlogon, making it crucial to apply.
- Ensure your system is up to date and backups are taken before installing.

**Preconditions**:
- Users must confirm their version and architecture of Windows to download the correct update package.
